name: ribby
content:
ribby adjective
(BODY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
If a person or an animal is ribby, the ribs (= bones that curve round from the back to the chest) can be clearly seen. : You have lost so much weight that you're beginning to look a bit ribby. The cows were all very ribby following the long drought.
More examplesFewer examplesA group of ribby horses was standing on the far side of the field.You shouldn't worry if your cat gets a bit ribby, as it's perfectly normal for this breed.

Animal physiology: thin or slender (of people)
ribby adjective
(PATTERN)
Ribby clothing or material has a pattern of raised parallel lines: She was wearing her favourite red ribby top. I'm most comfortable wearing a pair of ribby socks over leggings.
More examplesFewer examplesI prefer to use a ribby fabric for these kinds of garments.The soft, slightly textured feel of these ribby cloths makes them perfect for washing babies.
